newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: KLM to run 8 percent more summer flights.
newsitem.headline: KLM to run 8 percent more summer flights.

text.p: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines said on Wednesday it will operate eight percent more flights during the 1997 summer season than in the previous year.
"For the period, which begins March 30 and continues through October 25, KLM will operate a total of 44,000 flights," KLM said in a statement.
The number of available seats during the period would also rise by eight percent to 11.3 million, the airline said.
KLM plans to add Abidjan, Ivory Coast, to its schedule with flights twice a week in combination with Freetown, Sierra Leone.
The Dutch carrier is dropping flights to Colombo, Sri Lanka, Conakry in Guinea and Khartoum in Sudan, describing these as "less profitable destinations".
It is also adding, through partner Northwest Airlines, daily connections from Amsterdam to Newark, New Jersey.
KLM has agreed a commercial partnership, including code sharing, with state-owned Sun Air of South Africa, it said.
The code share agreement involves flights to and from Durban and Cape Town which closely connect with KLM's flights between Amsterdam and Johannesburg, it added.
A cooperation with Kenya Airways, begun in November last year, on the route between Amsterdam and Nairobi will now be extended further, KLM said.
